Adult.description: The American Coot lacks the Common Gallinule's white stripe down the sides. It also has a white (not red) bill.

Juvenile.description: Juvenile American Coots differ from juvenile Common Gallinules by the color of the underparts: pale gray on American Coots and darker gray on Common Gallinules.

Adult.description: Purple Gallinules lack the white stripe down their sides that Common Gallinules have. They are also more brightly colored than Common Gallinules.

Juvenile.description: Juvenile Purple Gallinules are pale brown with bronze tints in the wings, whereas juvenile Common Gallinules are brownish gray overall.
